intro: Hieracium ciconium, commonly known as the great centaury, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and parts of western Asia, often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. The plant produces showy yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Hieracium ciconium is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in many temperate regions.
